answers.answer: Yea!  Glad to hear your news!Which still leaves some questions, though, right?  Diabetes is NOT what you want to have to complicate anything further, as I'm sure Jazzy will attest to.Keep up the good work, and let us know how things are going.  Hang in there and feel well!Zilla*
I meant to say he weighs 75 lbs.  Now 175.

question: However, I do have "pre diabetes" which I have had for over 10 years, so nothing new here.  My A1C was 5.3.  My numbers ever 1/2 hour were a little lower than what my monitor read.  So, maybe it's my monitor?  I don' tknow.  But I"m putting it away for a while and not thinking about it LOL!  So, that's that. So, what I still and only have is "neuropathy in my feet".  I'll keep taking the meds for that - the Gabapentin (neurotonin) and keep you guys updated.  I've decided that I am still going to go low carb and lose some weight. I don't understand my weight, this AM I got up and it was friggen 209 - I gained 1.5 in one day?  I need to go low carb to combat the effects this medication is having on my body - and it ain't good LOL!   Plus, I took my son to the Dr. yesterday, (he will be 6 in march), he is 3'10" tall and weighs 175, which is NOT good.  I need to find out where he is getting all the calories from, cause it sure ain't at home.  I am going to start packing his lunches from now on.  ANd i am going to make a little workout area for us downstairs.  I'm going to find a video for mom/child to exercise too and we're going to get FIT.  Gotta go, work is getting my way of posting LOL!!
title: Guess what...I DO NOT have diabetes - YAY (m)..
